user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of response_completed_callback:
```c
static void
response_completed_callback (void *cls,
                             struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                             void **req_cls,
                             enum MHD_RequestTerminationCode toe)
{
  struct UploadContext *uc = *req_cls;
  (void) cls;         /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) connection;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) toe;         /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (NULL == uc)
    return; /* this request wasn't an upload request */
  if (NULL != uc->pp)
  {
    MHD_destroy_post_processor (uc->pp);
    uc->pp = NULL;
  }
  if (-1 != uc->fd)
  {
    (void) close (uc->fd);
    if (NULL != uc->filename)
    {
      fprintf (stderr,
               "Upload of file `%s' failed (incomplete or aborted), removing file.\n",
               uc->filename);
      (void) unlink (uc->filename);
    }
  }
  if (NULL != uc->filename)
    free (uc->filename);
  free (uc);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions were found in the provided function. I checked for common explicit extensions that compiler docs typically list (and that MISRA Rule 1.2 prohibits), including: GCC/Clang/TCC/MSC extensions such as __attribute__ annotations, __builtin_* functions, typeof, statement-expressions ({ … }), nested functions, inline assembly (asm), or use of compiler-specific keywords (e.g. __extension__, __inline__ vs inline), and none are present. The (void) casts, static function specifier, enum parameter, use of POSIX functions (close, unlink) and standard library calls (fprintf, free, NULL) are standard C or library usage, not compiler language extensions. Therefore there are no code fragments that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
